fields_of_interest: Culture, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Youth, Single market, Trans-European Networks
eu_initiatives: Fondazione Centro Produttività Veneto works as private employment service accredited by the Regional Government. It delivers active labour market policies for all workers and is particularly involved in implementing Youth Guarantee actions as well as in developing initiatives in the framework of the New Skills Agenda. One of the core activity performed by CPV is training and professional mobility. Since 2003, CPV has been managing thousands of work placements abroad currently also funded by the ESF and Youth Guarantee Programme. CPV has gained a long-lasting quality experience in organizing and implementing learning mobility experiences strictly connected with active policies. goals__remit:
Fondazione Centro Produttività Veneto (CPV) was founded as an association of public and private entities, businesses and professionals in 1955. It promotes increased productivity and culture by disseminating knowledge of the latest business management techniques. Since its foundation, CPV has promoted a culture of workplace safety by running workshops and information days via its study groups, twelve organisations divided by sphere of interest. It also organises training and consultancy for local businesses as part of campaigns and initiatives funded by the Veneto Regional Government. Thanks to these study groups, freelance professionals and employers are able to provide information and training. Close links with the production industry enable the study groups to deal with current issues, but they do not carry out any trade union or commercial activity. CPV provides the following services:  
TRAINING SERVICES. Managerial, entrepreneurial and professional training is one of the main components of CPV’s mission. 
INNOVATION AREA. Founded in 1994, the Innovation Area is home to a Patent Library Centre (PATLIB), which is recognised by the European Patent Office. It provides information and studies on patents and offers consultancy services with the TRIZ and Kaizen methods. It also runs the Vicenza Matech Point, which provides services and consultancy on the research and use of new materials; technological innovation portals in the goldsmithery industry and a range of workshops; and the TMD Demotech Centre for Innovation in Schio. 
NEW-BUSINESS SUPPORT. Opened in 1998, this service is promoted by the Vicenza Chamber of Commerce and is coordinated by CPV. It provides free support for aspiring entrepreneurs in the delicate start-up phase. 
INTERNATIONAL ACTIVITIES. CPV works alongside and has links with technical and scientific organisations, businesses, public entities and trade associations, both in Italy and abroad. 
CSR HELPDESK. This service has promoted Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) since 2005. In 2011, CPV opened the Energy Helpdesk at the TMD Demotech Centre on behalf of the Vicenza Chamber of Commerce. CPV also runs this service, which helps businesses with their applications for third-party funding. 
INTERNATIONAL ACTIVITIES 
CPV gained a great experience in Pilot Projects in the field of VET, particularly regarding EQF and ECVET and in managing international learning mobility projects mainly funded in the framework of Leonardo da Vinci Programme and targeting students/trainees and teaching staff.
